columns.name: patid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD GOLD

columns.name: vmid
columns.description: Old VM id for the patient when the practice was using the VAMP system

columns.name: gender
columns.description: Patient’s gender

columns.name: yob
columns.description: Patient’s year of birth. This is actual year of birth e.g. 1984

columns.name: mob
columns.description: Patient’s month of birth (for those aged under 16). 0 indicates no month set

columns.name: marital
columns.description: Patient’s current marital status

columns.name: famnum
columns.description: Family ID number

columns.name: chsreg
columns.description: Value to indicate whether the patient is registered with Child Health Surveillance

columns.name: chsdate
columns.description: Date of registration with Child Health Surveillance

columns.name: prescr
columns.description: type of prescribing exemption the patient has currently (e.g. medical / maternity)

columns.name: capsup
columns.description: Level of capitation supplement the patient has currently (e.g. low, medium, high)

columns.name: frd
columns.description: Date the patient first registered with the practice. If patient only has ‘temporary’ records, the date is the first encounter with the practice; if patient has ‘permanent’ records it is the date of the first ‘permanent’ record (excluding preceding temporary records)

columns.name: crd
columns.description: Date the patient’s current period of registration with the practice began (date of the first ‘permanent’ record after the latest transferred out period). If there are no ‘transferred out periods’, the date is equal to ‘frd’

columns.name: regstat
columns.description: Status of registration detailing gaps and temporary patients

columns.name: reggap
columns.description: Number of days missing in the patient’s registration details

columns.name: internal
columns.description: Number of internal transfer out periods, in the patient’s registration details

columns.name: tod
columns.description: Date the patient transferred out of the practice, if relevant. Empty for patients who have not transferred out

columns.name: toreason
columns.description: Reason the patient transferred out of the practice. Includes 'Death' as an option

columns.name: deathdate
columns.description: Date of death of patient – derived using a CPRD algorithm

columns.name: accept
columns.description: Flag to indicate whether the patient has met certain quality standards: 1 = acceptable, 0 = unacceptable

columns.name: pracid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a specific practice in CPRD GOLD

columns.name: region
columns.description: Value to indicate where in the UK the practice is based. The region denotes the ONS Region for practices within England, and the country i.e. Wales, Scotland, or Northern Ireland for the rest

columns.name: lcd
columns.description: Date of the last collection for the practice

columns.name: uts
columns.description: Date at which the practice data is deemed to be of research quality. Derived using a CPRD algorithm that primarily looks at practice death recording and gaps in the data

columns.name: staffid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to the practice staff member entering the data

columns.name: gender
columns.description: Staff member’s gender

columns.name: role
columns.description: Role of the member of staff who created the event

Patient Identifier.name: patid
Patient Identifier.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD GOLD

Event Date.name: eventdate
Event Date.description: Date associated with the event, as entered by the GP

System Date.name: sysdate
System Date.description: Date the event was entered into Vision

Consultation type.name: constype
Consultation type.description: type of consultation (e.g. Surgery Consultation, Night Visit, Emergency etc.)

Consultation Identifier.name: consid
Consultation Identifier.description: The consultation identifier linking events at the same consultation, when used in combination with pracid

Staff Identifier.name: staffid
Staff Identifier.description: The identifier of the practice staff member entering the data. A value of 0 indicates that the staffid is unknown

Duration.name: duration
Duration.description: The length of time (minutes) between the opening, and closing of the consultation record

Patient Identifier.name: patid
Patient Identifier.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD GOLD

Event Date.name: eventdate
Event Date.description: Date associated with the event, as entered by the GP

System Date.name: sysdate
System Date.description: Date the event was entered into Vision

Consultation type.name: constype
Consultation type.description: Code for the category of event recorded within the GP system (e.g. diagnosis or symptom)

Consultation Identifier.name: consid
Consultation Identifier.description: Identifier that allows information about the consultation to be retrieved, when used in combination with pracid

Medical Code.name: medcode
Medical Code.description: CPRD unique code for the medical term selected by the GP

SNOMED CT Concept ID3.name: sctid
SNOMED CT Concept ID3.description: The mapped SNOMED CT Concept ID. mapping is conducted prior to data transfer and will vary by mapping version used.

SNOMED description ID.name: sctdescid
SNOMED description ID.description: When direct selection and entry of SNOMED CT terms is permitted this will contain the description ID of the selected term. This field will be NULL when map type = 4 (data entered as Read code)

SNOMED Expression.name: sctexpression
SNOMED Expression.description: A placeholder for SNOMED CT post-coordinated expressions. This is not supported in early phases of SNOMED implementation.

SNOMED mapping type.name: sctmaptype
SNOMED mapping type.description: Indicates the native encoding of the record in the Vision software (4 = term selected from Read dictionary, 5 = term selected from SNOMED CT)

SNOMED mapping Version.name: sctmapversion
SNOMED mapping Version.description: The version of the READ-SNOMED CT mapping table applied

SCT Is Indicative.name: sctisindicative
SCT Is Indicative.description: Reserved for use when systems write SNOMED CT terms natively. Used to indicate the reliability of the reverse SNOMED CT-Read map. Where SNOMED CT codes do not have a direct mapping to READ, the code ‘Rz…00’ will be utilised.

SCT Is Assured.name: sctisassured
SCT Is Assured.description: Indicates whether the Read to SNOMED mapping has been verified by a panel of physicians

Staff Identifier.name: staffid
Staff Identifier.description: Identifier of the practice staff member entering the data. A value of 0 indicates that the staffid is unknown

Episode.name: episode
Episode.description: Episode type for a specific clinical event

Entity type.name: enttype
Entity type.description: Identifier that represents the structured data area in Vision where the data was entered

Additional Details Identifier.name: adid
Additional Details Identifier.description: Identifier that allows additional information to be retrieved for this event, when used in combination with pracid. A value of 0 signifies that there is no additional information associated with the event.

columns.name: staffid

columns.name: source
columns.description: Classification of the source of the referral e.g. GP, Self

columns.name: nhsspec
columns.description: Referral speciality according to the National Health Service (NHS) classification

columns.name: fhsaspec
columns.description: Referral speciality according to the Family Health Services Authority (FHSA) classification

columns.name: inpatient
columns.description: Classification of the type of referral, e.g. Day case, In patient

columns.name: attendance
columns.description: Category describing whether the referral event is the first visit, a follow-up etc.

columns.name: urgency
columns.description: Classification of the urgency of the referral e.g. Routine, Urgent

columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD GOLD

columns.name: staffid
columns.description: Identifier of the practice staff member entering the data. A value of 0 indicates that the staffid is unknown

columns.name: immstype
columns.description: Individual components of an immunisation, e.g. Mumps, Rubella, Measles

columns.name: stage
columns.description: Stage of the immunisation given, e.g. 1, 2, B2

columns.name: status
columns.description: Status of the immunisation e.g. Advised, Given, Refusal

columns.name: compound
columns.description: Immunisation compound administered – may be a single or multicomponent preparation, e.g. MMR

columns.name: source
columns.description: Location where the immunisation was administered, e.g. In this practice

columns.name: reason
columns.description: Reason for administering the immunisation, e.g. Routine measure

columns.name: method
columns.description: Route of administration for the immunisation, e.g. Oral, Intramuscular

columns.name: batch
columns.description: Immunisation batch number

columns.name: patid
columns.description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD GOLD

columns.name: eventdate
columns.description: Date associated with the event, as entered by the GP

columns.name: sysdate
columns.description: Date the event was entered into Vision

columns.name: consid
columns.description: Identifier that allows information about the consultation to be retrieved, when used in combination with pracid

columns.name: prodcode
columns.description: CPRD unique code for the treatment selected by the GP

columns.name: drugdmd
columns.description: The mapped drug DMD code

columns.name: staffid
columns.description: Identifier of the practice staff member entering the data. A value of 0 indicates that the staffid is unknown

columns.name: dosageid
columns.description: Identifier that allows dosage information on the event to be retrieved. Use the Common Dosages Lookup to obtain the anonymised dosage text and extracted numerical information such as daily dose.

columns.name: bnfcode
columns.description: Code representing the chapter & section from the British National Formulary for the product selected by GP

columns.name: qty
columns.description: Total quantity entered by the GP for the prescribed product

columns.name: numdays
columns.description: Number of treatment days prescribed for a specific therapy event

columns.name: numpacks
columns.description: Number of individual product packs prescribed for a specific therapy event

columns.name: packtype
columns.description: Pack size or type of the prescribed product

columns.name: issueseq
columns.description: Number to indicate whether the event is associated with a repeat schedule. Value of 0 implies the event is not part of a repeat prescription. A value ≥ 1 denotes the issue number for the prescription within a repeat schedule

columns.name: prn
columns.description: Indicates if the prescription is to be supplied ‘as required’. Field available to GPs from end 2020.
CPRD unique code for the medical term selected by the GP
Read Code
description of the medical term
CPRD unique code for the treatment selected by the GP
Unique product identifier from the NHS Dictionary of Medicines and Devices (dm+d) – the NHS standard dictionary for products licensed in the UK
Gemscript product code for the corresponding product name - should be treated as a string field as it contains leading ‘0’’s
Product name as entered at the practice
Drug substance
Strength of the product
Form of the product e.g. tablets, capsules etc
Route of administration of the product
British National Formulary (BNF) code
British National Formulary (BNF) chapter
